meanings.definition: A person or thing that keeps track of time.
meanings.sent1: My mom is the timekeepers in our family, always reminding us when it's time for dinner.
meanings.sent2: The clock on the wall is a reliable timekeepers, ensuring we are never late.
meanings.sent3: The cat thinks she's the timekeepers of the house, meowing loudly when it's breakfast time.
meanings.sent4: The old grandfather clock stood tall in the hallway, a majestic timekeepers of the past.
meanings.sent5: The sun setting over the horizon serves as nature's timekeepers, signaling the end of another day.

meanings.definition: A device used to measure or indicate time.
meanings.sent1: The smartwatch on my wrist is a handy timekeepers, helping me stay punctual.
meanings.sent2: The hourglass is a traditional timekeepers, used in ancient times to measure time.
meanings.sent3: The quirky alarm clock decided to play a prank, pretending to be a timekeepers from the future.
meanings.sent4: The digital clock on the microwave is a modern timekeepers, always accurate to the second.
meanings.sent5: The ticking of the wall clock echoed through the room, a constant reminder of its role as a timekeepers.
